description: In Slovakia, Peter Pellegrini wins the presidential election with 53% against Ivan Korcok's 47%. Korcok gracefully concedes, emphasizing respect for the result. The election focused on differing views on the Ukraine conflict, with Pellegrini advocating peace talks. The victory reflects Slovakia's stance on war and diplomacy.
title: Peter Pellegrini wins Slovakia presidential elections

description: The UN world food programme in Afghanistan raises concerns over escalating malnutrition rates among women and children, with Kabul witnessing a tripling of cases in three years. Decreased humanitarian aid is exacerbating the issue, impacting mental health and facilities for malnourished patients. Poverty, insecurity, and Taliban restrictions further worsen the situation.
title: UN raises alarm on surging malnutrition in Afghan women and children

description: Rahul Gandhi pledges to conduct surveys for wealth redistribution and ensure fair representation for marginalized groups post-elections. He criticizes the underrepresentation of these groups in key sectors and commends Telangana for rejecting divisive politics.
title: Rahul Gandhi vows survey for wealth redistribution

description: Tens of thousands of Israelis protest in Tel Aviv demanding elections and Netanyahu's resignation as the Gaza conflict hits its seventh month. Opposition leader Yair Lapid criticizes leadership. Clashes were reported, and one arrest was made. Families of Gaza hostages join demonstration as army recovers twelfth hostage body. Conflict toll: over 33,000 deaths in Gaza, 129 hostages remain.
title: Massive protests in Tel Aviv against Netanyahu

description: Ukraine's President Zelenskiy raises alarms over air defence capabilities amidst Russia's bombing campaign, stressing the need for Patriot systems. Despite facing civilian casualties and infrastructure damage, Zelenskiy remains hopeful for US Congress support, open to various aid options. The conflict near the Russian border underscores the urgency for international assistance.
title: Ukraine's Zelenskiy warns of air defence shortage amid Russian attacks

description: Netaji's family condemns Kangana Ranaut's distortion of history, asserting his role as the first PM of undivided India and Azad Hind. They reject attempts to undermine Nehru and Congress using Bose.
title: 'Nehru was first PM': Kin of Bose counter Kangana Ranaut

description: Abhishek Manu Singhvi challenged the Himachal Pradesh Rajya Sabha election result at Himachal HC, disputing Harsh Mahajan's victory over a tie. The election saw Congress lose despite having a majority due to cross-voting.
title: After losing HP RS poll, Singhvi challenges draw of lots in HC

description: PM Modi reaffirmed BJP's success in governance, emphasizing transparency, inclusive development, and empowerment of marginalized groups. The NDA alliance's diversity and commitment to 'Nation First' were key points in his address on the party's foundation day.
title: On BJP birthday, PM says it's now 'India's preferred party'

description: Airline passengers in the UK and Ireland faced travel disruptions as Storm Kathleen led to flight cancellations at airports, impacting Dublin, Manchester, Belfast, Isle of Man, and Belfast International. The storm also affected rail and ferry services in Scotland, causing power outages in Ireland.
title: Storm Kathleen causes flight cancellations in UK and Ireland

description: Kshatriya community protests in Gujarat against BJP's veteran Parshottam Rupala, planning 400 candidates for 'Operation Rupala' post controversial remarks; tensions escalate in Ahmedabad with Karni Sena, johar threats, and police intervention.
title: Kshatriya outfits plot 'Op Rupala', to field 400 against BJP neta

description: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde's son Shrikant announced as Mahayuti's Kalyan candidate by Devendra Fadnavis amid BJP workers' support for MLA Ganpat Gaikwad. Contesting against Shiv Sena's Vaishali Darekar in a region with brewing differences and CM Shinde's stronghold.
title: Amid protest, Fadnavis says Shinde's son is Kalyan nominee

description: A missile narrowly missed a vessel near Hodeidah, Yemen, with no harm to the crew. US-led coalition intercepted one missile while the other landed in the water. Conflicts involving Huthi rebels and nations like Israel, Britain, and the US escalate. Huthi leader acknowledges casualties and vows to target Red Sea shipping.
title: Missile narrowly misses vessel southwest of Yemeni port: UK agency

description: Amit Shah criticizes Mallikarjun Kharge's 'Kashmir se kya waasta hai' remark, emphasizing J&K's integral part in India, Rajasthan's sacrifices, and Nadda's correction on Article 370, showing Congress's lack of understanding of Indian culture.
title: Amit Shah takes 'Italian culture' dig at Cong after Kharge attacks PM

description: Sudarshan Haripal, a BJD candidate from Rengali, started as a poster boy. His journey showcases the impact of a broken hand pump incident in 2012, leading him to embrace politics and serve society.
title: BJD's Rengali pick used to paste posters, now is on them

description: A deadly gunfight at a bar in Doral, Florida, resulted in two deaths and seven injuries. The conflict escalated between customers, leading to a fatal shooting of a security guard. Doral police officers exchanged gunfire with the assailant, resulting in the shooter's death. Investigations are ongoing to determine the motive behind the incident.
title: Deadly gunfight at South Florida bar leaves 2 dead, 7 injured

description: Centenarians in Tamil Nadu and Puducherry cast postal votes without age proof. Anjalai Rayappan, 100, voted secretly. Ramakkal Naidu, 101, supports AIADMK. S Angappan, 103, died post-enrollment for postal voting.
title: Centenarians show childlike joy as postal voting begins

description: YSRCP MLA MS Babu of Puthalapattu, Chittoor, joined Congress after meeting APCC chief YS Sharmila in Kadapa. Third Chittoor legislator to exit YSRCP before general elections, as per Sandeep Raghavan report.
title: LS polls: Babu 3rd YSRCP legislator to exit party in run-up

description: Modi's confident about BJP's third term win in Pushkar. He vows strong anti-corruption actions. Accuses Congress of corruption and outsourcing. Highlights massive spending, fake beneficiaries, and corruption schemes.
title: Brace for bigger action on graft in 1st 100 days of 3rd term: PM

description: Adhikari urges EC action after NIA attack linked to Mamata's instigation. Bajoria demands cop removal. Aftab, Bose, Basu criticize NIA misuse. Majumdar shocked, CPM blames BJP-TMC alliance pre-LS elections.
title: Assault on NIA must be put down with an iron hand: WB guv

description: Mumbai teenager dies by suicide after cyber fraud linked to a fake SMS. Clicked on fraudulent link, lost Rs 2 lakh, panicked, consumed pesticide, and frothed at the hospital. Police investigating.
title: Rs 2 lakh lost in cyber fraud, Mumbai teen ends life

description: On Saturday, Ernakulam Rural police detained ten people in connection with the death of migrant worker Asok Das (32). Das died after being beaten by a crowd on Thursday night. The suspects were brought into custody on Friday, and their detention was registered after police changed the sections of the FIR to include murder accusations.
title: Arunachal man dies in Kerala assault, 10 held

description: Were women expected to "wear bangles and stay at home" when their honour and dignity were threatened as outsiders entered their homes and villages in the dead of night, Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee asked a few hours after violence marred NIA arrests of two 2022 blast suspects in East Midnapore's Bhupatinagar on Saturday?
title: NIA attacked locals, entered women's homes at night: Mamata

description: PM Modi highlighted the Ram temple, criticized Congress, defended leaders attending Ram Lalla idol consecration, and asserted his resilience against abuse at election rallies in UP and Rajasthan.
title: Congress manifesto cut off from country's aspirations: PM Modi

description: Canada's spy agency alleges India and Pakistan attempted to interfere in Canadian elections in 2019 and 2021. India denies, accuses Canada of meddling. CSIS report claims India and Pakistan sought to influence polls. Ministry of External Affairs refutes allegations. Inquiry ongoing into foreign interference by India and Pakistan in Canadian elections.
title: India, Pak tried to 'interfere' in Canada polls: Spy agency

description: Yogi Adityanath emphasized India's anti-terrorism actions in Pakistan, BJP's anti-corruption stance, and global leadership in counterterrorism efforts, referencing a Guardian report on Indian government-ordered killings in Pakistan. He said, "Two days ago, the Guardian in an article claimed how terrorists were killed. The source of this information can only be shared by the Guardian. BJP's intention is also clear."
title: Yogi cites UK report, asserts BJP has 'zero tolerance for terror'

description: Pakistan reaffirms its sovereignty stance following India's Defense Minister's comments on potential incursions. The Foreign Office criticizes India's provocations and calls for accountability. Singh emphasizes India's peaceful intentions but warns against terrorism promotion. Both nations stress national security commitments amid escalating tensions, highlighting the need for responsible diplomacy.
title: Will safeguard our sovereignty: Pak on Rajnath's remarks

description: An appalling incident in Tarn Taran village where a woman was stripped and made to walk naked due to her son's elopement. The viral video has sparked outrage, leading to demands for justice. Three suspects apprehended, two at large. Punjab State Commission for Women involved. FIR filed under IPC sections.
title: 3 arrested, search on for 2 more for stripping woman

description: In her first campaign rally for the 2024 Lok Sabha elections in Jaipur, Congress leader Sonia Gandhi launched a direct attack on Prime Minister Narendra Modi, accusing him of putting himself before the country, scheming to rewrite the constitution, and destroying democracy. "PM Modi is stripping the country and democracy of dignity", she said.
title: PM Modi stripping dignity of country, democracy: Sonia Gandhi

description: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh reaffirmed India's stance on pursuing terrorists into Pakistan and emphasized secure borders. He advocated for 'One Nation, One Election' and reiterated the BJP's commitment to building the Ram Mandir. Singh highlighted government achievements in revoking Article 370 and implementing CAA, ensuring no expulsion of Indian Muslims.
title: India to give befitting reply if anyone tries to stoke terror: Rajnath Singh

description: Sanjay Singh discusses AAP's campaign strategy, alliance with Congress, and challenges from BJP. Emphasizes unity against BJP's anti-democratic actions and affirms Arvind Kejriwal's leadership in AAP despite ongoing legal issues.
title: If Kejriwal quits, BJP will crush AAP and its govt: Sanjay Singh

description: A recent Microsoft report reveals China's AI use in Lok Sabha elections to influence outcomes, with minimal immediate impact expected. China's AI experimentation for memes, videos, and audio poses future risks. Taiwan's election saw AI-generated audio clips spreading misinformation. China employs memes and AI anchors for election influence.
title: China may use AI to influence LS polls for own benefit: Microsoft

description: Wipro appoints Srinivas Pallia as the new CEO, succeeding Thierry Delaporte immediately. Pallia, with industry expertise, faces challenges post senior-level departures. Delaporte resigns effective April 6, 2024. Pallia was approved as CEO and MD for a 5-year term. Wipro, a global IT giant, trusts Pallia to drive growth in the tech industry.
title: Delaporte quits as Wipro CEO, Srinivas Pallia is new chief

description: On Saturday, the Enforcement Directorate told a Delhi court that the people charged in the excise policy case, including former deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia, were deliberately delaying the trial. ED claimed that delay in trial - cited as reason by Sisodia's counsel why the former minister should be given bail - was caused by the accused, not the prosecution.
title: Manish Sisodia delaying trial, claims ED; custody extended

description: A young girl named Rani from a village is captivated by questions about the sky and the moon's distance, inspired by Chandrayaan's mission. NCERT introduces class III textbooks under the National Curriculum Framework 2023, promoting critical thinking and values. The English textbook 'Santoor' emphasizes inclusive themes and language-math integration.
title: Chandrayaan flies into NCERT textbook now

description: A 55-year-old hawker, Harish Chandra Nadar, accused in the 1993 Mumbai communal riots, was acquitted by a sessions court due to lack of evidence. Nadar, arrested earlier this year, was cleared of charges related to rioting and arson. The defense highlighted Nadar's unawareness of the case status, leading to his acquittal.
title: Hawker accused in 1993 riots acquitted after 31 yrs

description: An NIA officer was injured and a vehicle belonging to the agency was damaged in stone pelting in Bengal's East Medinipur district Saturday when a "unruly" mob of local villagers attempted to obstruct an NIA team from arresting two alleged conspirators behind a blast that killed three people in Bhupatinagar village in 2022.
title: After ED, now NIA team attacked in Bengal, officer hurt

description: Vistara's 98% pilots agree to new pay deal amidst merger with Air India. CEO Vinod Kannan addresses concerns, aims to enhance operational stability. Challenges include reduced pay, flight disruptions, and rostering issues. Efforts underway to improve operations and accommodate more passengers.
title: 98% of pilots have signed new pay deal: Vistara CEO

description: Former JMM MLA Paulus Surin and extremist Jaitha Kachhap found guilty in a 2013 double-murder case in Jharkhand. Surin faces conviction under IPC Section 302 and Arms Act Section 27. Sentencing on April 10 by additional judicial commissioner Dinesh Kumar. Victims Bhushan Kumar Singh and Ram Govind attacked while playing cards near Surin's residence.
title: Jharkhand ex-MLA found guilty in murder case

description: PM Modi slammed the Congress manifesto, calling it a slew of lies that on every page demonstrated the party's goal to "dismember the nation" and warned the audience that it bore a significant Muslim League imprint while also being influenced by Leftists. "The (Congress) manifesto reflects actions similar to those of Muslim League during the struggle for Independence," he said.
title: Congress manifesto has Muslim League imprint: PM Modi

description: The NIA conducted raids in UP and Bihar to investigate a CPI (Maoist) conspiracy to expand in northern India. The group aims to revive influence in states like UP, Uttarakhand, Delhi, Punjab, Haryana, and Himachal Pradesh. NIA seized digital devices and incriminating materials in Ballia and Kaimur. Four accused were named in a chargesheet filed on Feb 9, 2024.
title: NIA raids UP, Bihar sites to foil Maoists' north India revival plan

description: India permits export of essential items to Maldives for 2024-25 fiscal year, strengthening bilateral ties. Maldives expresses gratitude for renewed quota under SAGAR agreement. India emphasizes 'Neighbourhood First' policy. Quantities of eggs, potatoes, onions, rice, wheat flour, sugar, pulses, stone aggregate, and river sand specified for export.
title: Maldives thanks India for goods, EAM says 'neighbourhood first'

description: Agnikul Cosmos postponed India's first semi-cryogenic rocket launch, Agnibaan, citing technical issues. The IIT Madras startup delayed liftoff twice, including a delay on March 22, due to minor observations during pre-launch checks. This comes after the company delayed the launch of the rocket scheduled for March 22 citing "unavoidable circumstances".
title: Launch of India's 1st semi-cryogenic rocket 2nd time in 2 weeks

description: Jos Buttler made a triumphant return to form with a brilliant century that outshone Virat Kohli's record-breaking 113, propelling Rajasthan Royals to a six-wicket victory over Royal Challengers Bengaluru in the IPL on Saturday. This win marks their fourth consecutive victory, placing them at the top of the table with a perfect record, while RCB's fourth defeat in a row sees them plummet to the eighth position.
title: Buttler century trumps Virat's record-extending ton
‘Mourn Mukhtar’s death, don’t celebrate Eid’, says hoarding outside Samajwadi Party's office
To monetize wife's YouTube , teacher uploads questions before exam
Royal specialist claims Prince Harry worried ahead of UK visit
Russian child genius' past life claims leave experts baffled

description: At Heathrow Airport, a collision occurred between a British Airways plane carrying 121 passengers and an empty Virgin Atlantic aircraft being towed. Although there were no injuries, both planes sustained wing damage. British Airways arranged an alternative flight for its passengers, while Virgin Atlantic conducted investigations and maintenance checks on its plane, which is temporarily out of service.
title: Two planes collide in UK airport

description: GW230529, detected in May 2023, marks the first observation of a gravitational wave involving a mass-gap object and a neutron star, challenging existing assumptions and sparking excitement in the scientific community.
title: Scientists detect signal from collision 650 million light years away

description: Researchers discovered 13 new papillomaviruses in Antarctic seals, emphasizing the importance of understanding virome for ecosystem conservation in Antarctica.
title: Researchers uncover 13 new Papillomaviruses in Antarctic seals

description: Virat Kohli smashed his 8th IPL 100 off 67 balls, that was his 9th in T20 cricket and the first against Rajasthan Royals. Virat remained unbeaten on 113 off 72 balls and his knock was studded with 4 sixes and 12 fours, powering RCB to 183/3. However, Virat equalled the record of the slowest IPL hundreds (by balls taken).
title: Kohli equals unwanted record despite 67-ball ton

description: Velella velella, colonial sea creatures, create a fascinating spectacle on west coast beaches. Their boom-and-bust cycles, link to ocean temperatures, and impact on marine ecosystems raise concerns among scientists.
title: 'Mysterious' tide: Alien-like sea creatures blanket US beaches

description: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi criticized the recent ED raids, referring to the Enforcement Directorate as the 'Extortion Directorate'. He made these remarks during a rally in Telangana where the Congress also launched its manifesto. He outlined the Congress manifesto, emphasizing five guarantees including justice for youth, women, farmers, laborers, and resource sharing.
title: 'ED has become Extortion Directorate': Rahul in Telangana

description: Virat Kohli struck the first century of this year's Indian Premier League as he steered Royal Challengers Bengaluru to 183-3 against Rajasthan Royals on Saturday. The star batsman reached his eighth IPL ton in 67 balls and finished on an unbeaten 113 after Bengaluru were invited to bat first in the 19th match of the T20 tournament in Jaipur. Kohli reached the three-figure mark with a single off Nandre Burger and took off his helmet and raised his bat to cheering crowd.
title: Virat Kohli fires record-extending 8th IPL ton

description: Vistara pilots unhappy about pay cuts due to Air India merger. 98% signed agreement. Tata Group merging AIX Connect into Air India Express. LCC merger smooth, facing disruption. Kannan addresses challenges, deploys larger aircraft.
title: End of Vistara crisis? Over 98% pilots have signed new contract

description: Put into bat by Rajasthan Royals captain Sanju Samson, Virat Kohli and Faf du Plessis put up a 125-run opening stand in a brilliant display of power-hitting. The 125-run partnership was not only the highest partnership of IPL 2024, but Kohli and du Plessis added more runs today (as a pair) than they collectively managed across the last four innings (124).
title: Records Virat and Du Plessis smashed against Rajasthan Royals

description: As the 2024 North American solar eclipse draws near, with totality set to be observed in 15 US states, astrologer Susan Miller and experts shed light on the unusual phenomena that accompany this celestial event.
title: 6 strange things that may happen during 2024 solar eclipse

description: Three died in southeastern China due to violent winds during a severe weather spell. Investigations ongoing as wind speeds exceeded level 12, leading to widespread disruptions.
title: Three 'sucked out' of apartments as typhoon-like winds ravage China

description: Amit Shah criticizes Congress, defends Article 370 abrogation, asserts Jammu and Kashmir's integration, questions Sonia Gandhi's comprehension. Congress challenges PM Modi's leadership, foreign policy, and RSS influence, demanding accountability for promises made.
title: Amit Shah takes 'Italian culture' dig at Congress after Kharge attacks PM

description: Virat Kohli made IPL history on Saturday, surpassing 7,500-run mark in a match against Rajasthan Royals. He achieved this milestone in the 7th over after Rajasthan opted to bowl in Jaipur. Shikhar Dhawan is second on the list of most run-scorers in the tournament with 6755 runs.
title: Kohli becomes first batter to score 7,500 IPL runs
How ISI wields influence over Pakistan's judiciary

description: Srini Pallia has been appointed as Wipro's new Chief Executive Officer and Managing Director. Since joining Wipro in 1992, he has held various leadership roles, including President of Wipro’s Consumer Business Unit and Global Head of Business Application Services.
title: Who is Srini Pallia, Wipro’s new CEO & MD

description: Rajnath Singh on Saturday took a dig at Congress leader Rahul Gandhi likening him to Mahendra Singh Dhoni, calling the Congress leader as the "best finisher" in Indian politics. Singh also said that Congress shares an 'unbreakable' association with corruption, drawing a comparison to the song "Tu Chal Mein Aai" (I will follow you).
title: Why Rajnath Singh compared Rahul Gandhi to Dhoni

description: Wipro's CEO Thierry Delaporte resigns, with Srinivas Pallia set to become CEO and Managing Director from April 7 as per company announcement. Pallia, former CEO for Americas 1, will lead the transition on the specified date.
title: Wipro CEO Thierry Delaporte resigns; Srinivas Pallia to succeed him

description: Discover our picks for the best Window ACs available online. They are reliable choices for your cooling needs.
title: Your guide to the top air conditioners for comfort
Greta Thunberg detained by Dutch authorities

description: Sourav Ganguly emphasized on Rishabh Pant's need for time before T20 World Cup selection despite fitness. After returning to professional cricket after a terrifying car accident in December 2022, Pant, the captain of the Delhi Capitals, appears to be making progress in the ongoing Indian Premier League with back-to-back half-centuries.
title: 'His form has been...': Ganguly on Pant's selection in T20 WC

description: SUVs dominate Indian car sales, but only a third meet official criteria for classification. Total car sales hit 4.23 million units, with SUVs claiming over 50% market share. Young buyers favor SUVs for style and tax benefits. Industry sees SUV evolution and diverse offerings reshaping market dynamics.
title: Are you sure you own an SUV? You may want to check again!
IMD issues heatwave alert for eastern, southern India

description: A fan faced an unexpected situation during an IPL match between SRH and CSK on Friday, when he found that his designated seat, for which he paid Rs 4,500, was missing. The fan claimed that he had to stand and watch the game at the Hyderabad's Stadium.
title: IPL: Fan books Rs 4,500 seat that 'doesn't exist'

description: In a joint operation, Chhattisgarh and Telangana security forces eliminated 3 Maoists in Bijapur district's forests, seizing weapons such as a light machine gun and an AK-47. This marks the third clash in the area, following a significant anti-Maoist operation that killed 13 insurgents in Gangaloor. The recent encounter was based on intelligence of Maoist movement near Telangana.
title: 3 Maoists shot dead in Chhattisgarh in joint op with Greyhounds
'Strengthened my resolve but...': AAP MP Sanjay Singh speaks about his 6-month stint in jail
'Do ladkon ki flop film': PM's jibe at Rahul and Akhilesh

description: A 99-year-old Indian-origin woman officially became a US citizen, taking the Oath of Allegiance at the USCIS Orlando office. The event was celebrated on social media, but it also sparked concerns about delays in the immigration process, with some users highlighting the challenges faced by immigrants in obtaining citizenship or green cards.
title: Indian-origin woman becomes US citizen at 99

description: The Kolkata Knight Riders, two-time champions, are currently leading the points table with an impeccable record of three wins in as many matches. Eager to uphold their winning streak, KKR is gearing up for an exhilarating showdown against the defending champions, Chennai Super Kings, at the iconic MA Chidambaram Stadium in Chennai this Monday.
title: Gautam Gambhir meets 'special fan', kisses his hand

description: Sunil Gavaskar suggests Royal Challengers Bengaluru focus on chasing targets with their strong batting to improve IPL performance. T20's entertainment value and innovative shots like switch-hits are highlighted. When the topic of Test cricket's future came up, Gavaskar assured everyone that the longest format would not disappear as many had feared.
title: Gavaskar reveals what RCB should do to revive fortunes

description: Leadership hiring in the IT sector is surging, driven by optimism for a stable business environment. Companies are actively recruiting senior IT talent, emphasizing diversity. Notable movements include strengthening of firms through key hires and a rise in demand for tech talent globally.
title: IT sector hiring alert! Headhunters see rising need for senior IT talent

description: Former India captain Sourav Ganguly on Saturday reprehended the fans booing Mumbai Indians skipper Hardik Pandya, saying it is not the fault of the player if he has replaced much-loved Rohit Sharma, who shepherded the team in previous seasons. Hardik has been at the receiving end of the fans' anger ever since Mumbai Indians announced that he will captain the five-time champions.
title: 'Not Hardik Pandya's fault if MI named him captain'

description: The BMW iX50, with enhanced power and unique design features, offers a thrilling driving experience like ICE vehicles. It boasts impressive specs and a luxurious interior, making it a top choice for those seeking a high-performance electric SUV.
title: BMW iX50 review: When even the 40 isn't enough!
Cyrus Mistry's sons are India’s richest billionaires under 30: Forbes
'Vyaktivaad' worse than 'parivaarvaad': Cong's Kanhaiya Kumar

description: British PM Rishi Sunak plays cricket, jokes with England cricketer James Anderson, asks for England team call up, and announces 35 million Pounds initiative for T20 World Cup matches, focusing on growing cricket programs for young people.
title: Watch: 'Am I ready?', UK PM plays cricket with England team

description: Russian Soyuz capsule safely landed in Kazakhstan with crew members O'Hara, Novitskiy, and Vasilevskaya. Belarusian Marina Vasilevskaya made history as the first citizen of the Republic of Belarus to travel to space. For O'Hara and Vasilevskaya this was the first mission but Novitskiy had already conducted three mission. The Soyuz MS-25 spacecraft remains docked at the station.
title: Russian Soyuz capsule carrying 3 crew safely lands in Kazakhstan

description: Pakistan PM Shehbaz Sharif takes action after suicide bomber killed Chinese engineers. Committee identifies officials for negligence. Security of Chinese citizens to be closely monitored. Attack affects dam projects, with Chinese investments in Pakistan under scrutiny.
title: Pak sends message to Beijing, punishes 5 for dam attack

description: Shivam Dube, a Chennai Super Kings player, is a strong contender for India's batting squad for the T20 World Cup. With a 148 runs tally and a strike rate of 160.86, Dube is among the top 10 batters this season. Former India all-rounder Irfan Pathan supports his selection. Matthew Hayden echoes Pathan's sentiment, praising Dube's consistency.
title: 'Would select him…': Ex-player on this CSK batter's T20 WC chances

description: Former Pakistan cricketer Ramiz Raja sparked controversy with recent remarks on Mohammad Amir, known for a spot-fixing scandal. Raja, in a TV interview, expressed disdain for Amir's past actions, emphasizing his uncompromising stance on cricket's moral standards. Despite serving a ban and returning to cricket, Amir's tainted image persists. Raja's comments coincide with Amir's bid to return to international cricket.
title: 'Mera beta bhi agar...': Ramiz slams 'tainted' Amir for comeback

description: 'Defiance: Fighting the Far Right' documentary on Channel 4 portrays British Indians' resilience against racism in the 1970s and 80s, emphasizing bravery in the face of violence and the fight for civil rights.
title: New UK docu examines racist attacks on British Indians
PM Modi tearing apart country's dignity, says Sonia Gandhi

description: Pakistan condemns India's alleged use of hired guns to eliminate terrorists. Rajnath Singh warns of retaliation in Pakistan, sparking outrage. Pakistan demands international accountability for India's actions, urging for regional peace.
title: Pak lashes out at India over Rajnath's 'terrorist' remark

description: BMCRI medical students at Victoria Hospital test positive for cholera, Ogawa serotype. Reports withheld. 70 females from Kaveri Hostel hospitalized, some in ICU. Poor hygiene, lack of safe water. Symptoms since Thursday. Infrastructure overhaul needed. Living conditions complaints.
title: 3 students of B'luru college test positive for cholera; 4 in ICU

description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi criticized the Congress manifesto, comparing it to the Muslim League's stance during the freedom movement. PM Modi stated that the manifesto's alignment with past ideologies showed a disconnect from modern India's aspirations. He highlighted the influence of leftist elements on the document. Congress manifesto was released at the party headquarters by party leaders Mallikarjun Kharge, Sonia Gandhi and Rahul Gandhi on Friday.
title: 'Muslim League imprint': PM Modi slams Cong's manifesto; Jairam Ramesh hits back

description: Priyanka criticizes PM Modi, mentions arrests, unfulfilled promises, leaked papers, farmer protests. Urges democracy safeguarding, mistrust in EVMs. Launches 'Nyay Patra' manifesto with Sonia Gandhi & Mallikarjun Kharge, emphasizing justice.
title: 'PM Modi living in hollow world ... ': Priyanka Gandhi at Jaipur

description: After the IPL 2024 match between Chennai Super Kings and Sunrisers Hyderabad, SRH players praised MS Dhoni for his significant impact on cricket. They shared a post-match clip on social media, recognizing him as a towering figure in cricket. Heinrich Klaasen praised Dhoni's legacy, stating that he will be remembered as a legend in the country.
title: 'Everyone is an MS Dhoni fan': SRH players laud CSK icon

description: India's diesel exports to Asia plummeted by 63% in March due to tough competition from Chinese and South Korean suppliers, affecting profit margins. Export volumes to Asia ranged from 11,000 to 189,000 bpd, with an average of 92,000 bpd in 2023-24. In contrast, diesel exports to Europe increased by 6.5% to 214,000 bpd.
title: India's diesel exports drop 63% due to China, South Korea competition

description: Ather Energy launches the Rizta electric scooter with 2.9 kWh and 3.7 kWh battery options, sleek design, riding modes, safety features, storage capacity, optional charger, and Halo helmets at competitive prices.
title: Ather's family electric scooter launched, check out its price

description: Royal Challengers Bengaluru will face Rajasthan Royals in a crucial Indian Premier League match at Jaipur. Virat Kohli, despite an inconsistent run, will dominate the match. RR are on an unbeaten streak of three matches, while RCB aim to improve their win-loss record. Despite a star-studded batting line-up, RCB have struggled to find collective form.
title: Virat Kohli's worrying stats in Jaipur ahead of RR-RCB clash

description: Anupam Mittal, Shark Tank India judge, avoids dating apps due to unprofitability in India, skewed demographics, and invests in a crucial domain, believing in its long-term success.
title: Why Shark Tank judge Anupam Mittal not keen on investing in dating app

description: India to soon have ‘One Airspace’: India plans to consolidate airspace management across 2.8 million square nautical miles into a unified command center in Nagpur, benefiting airlines with cost savings and improved safety. The initiative aims to optimize air traffic, reduce fuel consumption, and streamline communication processes for pilots.
title: India prepares for ‘One Airspace’

description: Fraudsters exploit IPL fans with fake ticket websites like book.myshow-premium.net. Hyderabad Police warn against scams. Tips include checking holograms and avoiding unauthorised sellers. Stay updated on IPL team announcements for genuine tickets.
title: IPL ticket fraud: These two IPL ticket websites are fake

description: The T20 World Cup, to be co-hosted by West Indies and USA, is set to take place from June 2 to 29. Preceding this prestigious event, Pakistan will welcome New Zealand for a five-match T20I series starting on April 18. However, fans eagerly await the T20 World Cup group-stage clash between India and Pakistan, slated for June 9.
title: Watch: 'Maza aa raha hai?' Pak players carry rocks T20 WC training

description: Prepare for a smooth Italy trip by setting up international connectivity, saving emergency contacts, downloading essential apps, and managing currency exchanges efficiently for a hassle-free vacation experience.
title: Planning a trip to Italy, five important things to keep in mind

description: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee has raised concerns over the timing of the NIA's probe into the Medinipur blast case. The NIA team, en route to Kolkata, was attacked in Bhupatinagar. Banerjee criticized the midnight raid, stating that locals reacted as they would to any stranger visiting at that hour.
title: Mamata questions NIA's 'probe timing' after attack on agency

description: Elvish Yadav faced legal trouble after Noida Police charged him in a snake venom-rave party case. He was detained for supplying snake venom and sentenced to 14 days in custody.
title: Chargesheet against Elvish Yadav, 8 others in snake venom rave case

description: Union Minister and BJP leader Smriti Irani mocked the opposition INDIA bloc following the Communist Party of India (CPI)'s decision to nominate Annie Raja against Rahul Gandhi in Wayanad, despite being in alliance with the Congress party. Irani highlighted the contradictory actions of the Left parties, who on one hand propose Gandhi's candidacy in Uttar Pradesh, while on the other hand, exhibit solidarity through embraces during gatherings.
title: 'Delhi mein hugging, Karnataka mein...': Smriti takes jibe at oppn

description: The United States and China have agreed to hold "intensive exchanges on balanced growth", said a statement by the US Treasury Department, after two days of talks between Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen and her Chinese counterpart He Lifeng in Guangzhou. "These exchanges will facilitate a discussion around macroeconomic imbalances, including their connection to overcapacity, and I intend to use this opportunity to advocate for a level playing field for American workers and firms," said Yellen in a separate statement.
title: US, China to hold talks on 'balanced economic growth': US Treasury

description: Delhi Minister Atishi criticizes the Election Commission and urges the ED to reveal actions taken against BJP leaders in alleged money laundering cases. She questions the arrest of AAP leaders without solid evidence and emphasizes fair competition in elections. Atishi highlights the need for accountability and unbiased investigations in the political landscape.
title: Reveal action taken against BJP in 'money laundering' cases: Atishi

description: Sunrisers Hyderabad secured a six-wicket victory over Chennai Super Kings in the IPL match, and all-rounder Abhishek Sharma shared a heartwarming Instagram post with his mother and sister. Sharma's stellar performance, including a 37-run innings with an astonishing strike rate of 308.33, played a pivotal role in the team's victory.
title: 'Moments like these...': Abhishek shares heartwarming family pic

description: It is unclear if it's a recent video or an old one that resurfaced on social media, but the clip has garnered a lot of attention from the fans. Rohit has been replaced as the Mumbai Indians' captain by Hardik Pandya - a decision that the five-time IPL-winning franchise took ahead of the ongoing season and led to a lot of backlash from the fans.
title: Watch: Rohit Sharma on 'daddy duty', asks crowd to stay quiet

description: Hezbollah condemns Israel's strike on Iran's Damascus consulate, warning of escalating tensions. Iran vows revenge for Revolutionary Guards Corps members' deaths. Israel anticipates retaliation, reinforcing defense. Clash along Lebanon's border results in casualties. Hezbollah prepared to escalate conflict.
title: What Hezbollah said on Israel's strike on Iran consulate

description: A Delhi court has extended AAP leader Manish Sisodia's judicial custody until April 18. Sisodia, the former Delhi deputy chief minister, is currently held in Tihar jail in relation to the Delhi liquor case. He appeared at Delhi's Rouse Avenue Court today, where he reiterated his claim from April 2 that the investigative agencies have not provided evidence linking him to any money in the case.
title: Delhi court extends Sisodia's judicial custody till April 18

description: Tom Moody praised Sunrisers Hyderabad skipper Pat Cummins for his empowering and inclusive leadership style, drawing parallels with India's legendary captain MS Dhoni. Moody praised Cummins' adeptness in decision-making and ability to connect with players from diverse backgrounds, stating that he would do this seamlessly due to his natural leadership.
title: 'He is like Dhoni...': Moody hails Cummins' leadership style

description: Saudi Arabia has revised down its medium-term targets for Neom, a central part of Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman's vision to diversify the oil-reliant economy. Originally aimed to accommodate 1.5 million residents in The Line—a futuristic city envisioned within two mirror-clad skyscrapers—by 2030, the project's expectations have been adjusted to house under 300,000 residents by the same deadline, as per insider knowledge.
title: Saudis scale back ambition for $1.5 trillion desert project Neom

description: Iran has cautioned the United States against being ensnared in what it calls "Netanyahu's trap," with Mohammad Jamshidi, Deputy Chief of Staff for Political Affairs to the Iranian President, urging the US to avoid involvement to prevent being targeted. Following Iran's warning, the US has requested Iran to refrain from attacking American assets.
title: Iran tells US to step aside as it readies response to Israel

description: Krishnamurthy Subramanian, the Executive Director at the International Monetary Fund has said that the IMF’s GDP growth forecasts for India have been consistently ‘INACCURATE'. In response to Subramanian's remarks predicting an 8 percent growth rate for India, IMF spokesperson Julie Kozack stated that his comments were made in his capacity as India's representative.
title: Former CEA says IMF forecast for India ‘consistently inaccurate’

description: Pakistan cricketers Bismah Maroof and Ghulam Fatima sustained minor injuries in a car accident, preparing for the upcoming home series against West Indies Women. The Pakistan Cricket Board confirmed the incident and ensured they received immediate medical attention. The series is scheduled to begin on April 18.
title: Two Pakistan women cricketers injured in a car accident

description: A vehicle carrying NIA officials was on Saturday attacked by villagers in Bhupatinagar area of West Bengal's Purba Medinipur district, where they had gone to investigative a 2022 bomb blast case, police said. A team of NIA officials earlier this morning arrested two persons in connection with the case and were on their way back to Kolkata, when the vehicle came under attack, they said.
title: NIA team attacked in Bengal's Medinipur, official injured
Elon Musk says Tesla will unveil robotaxi in August

description: From the scorching deliveries of Mayank Yadav to Sunil Narine's explosive performances, the second week of the 2024 Indian Premier League witnessed astonishing exhibition of skills on the cricket field. Times of India highlights some of the standout performers in the second week of the season, who made it to the 'Team of the Week'.
title: IPL 2024, Week 2: TOI's team of the week

description: A fossil of a Pliosaurus, dubbed "Sea-Rex," found on Dorset's Jurassic Coast sets a Guinness record for completeness. With 95% of its surface area preserved, it boasts a formidable bite force estimated at 33,000 to 48,000 Newtons. Measuring nearly 2 meters long, it dates back 150 million years, providing insights into ancient marine predators.
title: 150 million years old 'sea monster' unearthed on UK coast

description: Chennai Super Kings skipper Ruturaj Gaikwad praised Sunrisers Hyderabad's bowling performance after a six-wicket defeat in the Indian Premier League 2024. He acknowledged the team's slow start and batting powerplay, but also acknowledged conceded runs and dropped catch. Despite these challenges, Gaikwad praised CSK's effort to push the match to the 19th over.
title: '1 dropped catch & 1 expensive over...': Ruturaj on CSK's loss

description: Congress commits to rectifying defense issues, including China border status, Agnipath, OROP, soldiers' pensions. Pledges to boost defense spending, establish NSC oversight, address Ladakh, Galwan, Doklam, Siliguri Corridor, CDS, and armed forces requirements.
title: Will restore status quo ante on China front; scrap Agnipath: Cong

description: Mayank Yadav's numerology predicts a bright future with India's national team call, potential record-breaking, and commercial success. Advised on energy & aura management, sync for success, and spiritual focus for a prosperous career.
title: Mayank set to break Shoaib Akhtar’s record, reveals numerologist

description: A 21-year-old man was kidnapped, thrashed, and forced to drink urine in Agwanpur. Accused alleged harassment due to victim's misbehaviour. Victim wore a garland of shoes. Identified accused arrested. Victim's father claimed his son was tortured.
title: 3 held for assaulting man, forcing him to drink urine in UP

description: India targets $100 billion yearly in foreign direct investment, a positive shift from previous trends. Major companies like Apple and Samsung are expanding operations in India. Challenges include slow foreign investment growth due to global factors. Government plans to relax FDI regulations to boost investment in key sectors like electric vehicles and consumer goods.
title: India seeks $100 billion a year in FDI as it woos China hedgers

description: Odisha MLA Ramesh Chandra Sai switched from BJD to BJP, becoming the fifth legislator to switch camps. His move, along with others, may impact the upcoming polls in multiple seats.
title: Another BJD MLA joins BJP; fifth to switch camp

description: Scammers use complex methods for financial fraud. Government ministries raise awareness. Delhi Police shares tips to identify fake messages. Phishing attacks capture personal info, scammers impersonate bank reps, steal money from accounts.
title: Delhi police shares photos to spot fake online banking msg

description: Following a weather warning, shares of eight companies specializing in air conditioners, coolers, and fans surged over 8% this week. Gaurang Shah from Geojit Financial Services Ltd predicts rising demand for consumer durables and white goods, not just in metro areas but also in semi-urban and rural regions of India.
title: These stocks may emerge winner this summer

description: Sunrisers Hyderabad skipper Pat Cummins withdrew an appeal for obstructing the field against Chennai Super Kings' Ravindra Jadeja during the Indian Premier League match. The incident occurred in the 19th over of the CSK innings when SRH pacer Bhuvneshwar Kumar bowled a yorker to Jadeja, who jammed it out towards the bowler.
title: 'To keep Dhoni indoors?': Ex-player questions Cummins' decision

description: Eijaz Khan, renowned for his roles in significant television shows and the successful Bollywood film "Jawan," is enthusiastic about his upcoming project "Adrishyam - The Invisible Heroes." In this new show, he takes on the role of an undercover agent, marking his return. .Eijaz Khan's journey from TV to films includes 'Thakshak' and 'Kuch Naa Kaho'. Despite 'Jawan' not meeting expectations, he values the experience and hopes for due credit. Working with Shah Rukh Khan was a dream come true.
title: Eijaz Khan speaks on how Jawan's success changed things for him

description: Rajasthan Royals' early IPL victories are credited to their strong bowling unit comprising Trent Boult, Nandre Burger, Yuzendra Chahal, Ravichandran Ashwin, Sandeep Sharma and Avesh Khan under the leadership of Sanju Samson. They have secured wins against key teams and look forward to the next challenge against RCB at home.
title: IPL: Can RCB pass the RR bowling test?

description: SC on Friday ruled that citizens do not possess the right to repatriate the mortal remains of a foreign national to India. This decision came as the court rejected a plea from the Sufi Dargah in Prayagraj to bring back the mortal remains of its spiritual leader, Hazrat Shah. Although Shah was born in India, he acquired Pakistani citizenship in 1992 and passed away in Dhaka, Bangladesh.
title: No right to bring back foreigner’s mortal remain to India: SC

description: This year marks significant changes in the fortunes of two of tech's biggest titans, Elon Musk and Mark Zuckerberg. Musk has seen a substantial decrease in his wealth, losing $48.4 billion, while Zuckerberg has experienced a dramatic rise, adding $58.9 billion to his fortune, propelled by the soaring success of Meta Platforms Inc. This surge has led to Meta reaching new record highs, including a notable peak on Friday.
title: Zuckerberg overtakes Elon Musk on world's billionaire list

description: The Enforcement Directorate argues against special privileges for Kejriwal in prison, citing misuse of legal meetings. Kejriwal's request for more counsel time is met with opposition, highlighting limitations in jail regulations. ED's noncooperation claim leads to Kejriwal's temporary confinement in Tihar Jail. Court to announce judgment on April 9.
title: ED: Kejriwal can’t get special rights to run govt from jail

description: The Enforcement Directorate argues against special privileges for Kejriwal in prison, citing misuse of legal meetings. Kejriwal's request for more counsel time is met with opposition, highlighting limitations in jail regulations. ED's noncooperation claim leads to Kejriwal's temporary confinement in Tihar Jail. Court to announce judgment on April 9.
title: ED: Kejriwal can’t get special rights to run govt from jail

description: Congress's strategy in Rajasthan faces challenges as prominent veterans like Ashok Gehlot and Sachin Pilot opt out, leading to reliance on lesser-known candidates. Despite hurdles, Congress aims to strengthen its position in key areas and navigate alliances for electoral success in the upcoming Lok Sabha elections.
title: Rajasthan Congress veterans flee arena, leave newbies on poll frontline

description: Araku Valley, known for its premium coffee, faces deep-rooted discontent among tribal farmers due to neglected basic needs and infrastructure. Despite high Nota votes, the region continues to struggle with improving living conditions and addressing voter dissatisfaction.
title: Araku emerges as highland for choosing ‘no candidate’

description: Maldives FM thanked India for export support amid strained ties. Renewed quota for 2024-2025 symbolizes friendship. DGFT lifts export restrictions on essential items. High Commissioner announces unique bilateral mechanism for increased trade.
title: Maldives thanks India for allowing export of essential commodities

description: An Indian student died in the US state of Ohio, and an inquiry is underway, according to the Indian consulate in New York, which has assured the family of all possible help. "Deeply saddened by the unfortunate demise of Mr. Uma Satya Sai Gadde, an Indian student in Cleveland, Ohio", Indian in New York said in a post on X.
title: Another Indian student dies in US, probe underway
